result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert R Petty Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3.5 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed. Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. No contact with the victim listed in dismissed case. No contact with known drug dealers or users. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

10:56 AM Defendant Robert R Petty Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Robert R Petty Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 20CF537 NO CONTEST. 
22CF166 Ct 1 without repeater, Ct 2 without repeater- NO CONTEST. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: 20CF537 GUILTY. 22CF166 Cts 1 & 2 without repeaters GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 
20CF537-
9 months Racine County Jai; SERVED.  
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge, payment plan $25/month commencing 9/15/22.

22CF166-
3.5 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed concurrent. 
3 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
120 DAYS STAYED. 
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored accordingly.
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with the victim listed in dismissed case. 
No contact with known drug dealers or users. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.

Eligible for both programs.

10:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert R Petty Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Robert R Petty Jr. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
21CF933 JT set for 8/23 at 1:30.

Defense requests to dismiss 21CF933 without prej and gives statement as to why, indicates 20CF537 and 22CF166 may be able to resolve. 
State indicates there is no reason to dismiss the case today and requests warrant be issued for alleged victim. Attorney Rich will be keeping these files. 
Defense responds and goes into history of 21CF933 and renews request to dismiss. 
BTC: Court indicates there was not a warrant drafted by State after Feb date and will issue a warrant today for the witness. Will not dismiss the case today. State needs to provide a new material witness warrant. Will set another status date.
